page.title: 08MODEL AND HOBBY EXHIBITION
page.content: The Frodsham Community Assosiaion and the Youth Club held their 4th annual exhibition at the Community Centre on Sunday, 30th June, 1985. The event was organised by Paul Rogers, assisted by Don Mellor, of the Community Assn. The carnival Queen, Helen Ashley, opened the Exhibition. She was accompanied by the Deputy Queen and Little Miss Frodsham. Admission was 50p for adults, 30p for children. Around 500 people attended, including exhibitors, who manned 20 stalls. Rail stock, ships, cars, aircraft and other models were on display. An amateur radio station contacted stations world wide. The local Philatelic Society hoped to recruit members. Lace-making, hand- spinning and broom-crochet, ribbon flower-makers demonstrated their skills. School children presented their puppets and model houses.
